text_for_ai:
Titre: Metaplanet leans into Bitcoin debt play with fresh $130M to buy more BTC
Résumé: The fresh debt draw shows how Metaplanet is using both debt and preferred equity to accelerate Bitcoin purchases and income-generation strategies.

Titre: Monad airdrop farmer spends full $112K MON reward on gas for failed trades
Résumé: A suspected airdrop farmer burned through their entire $112,000 of MON rewards in hundreds of failed transaction attempts.

Titre: Strike CEO debanked by JPMorgan as Lummis sounds ‘Chokepoint 2.0’ alarm
Résumé: Strike CEO Jack Mallers said JPMorgan closed his accounts without explanation, reigniting fears of Operation Chokepoint 2.0 and renewed pressure on crypto companies.

Titre: Solana ETFs pull $369M in November as investors look to productive yield assets
Résumé: Solana ETFs have pulled in $369 million so far this month as investors appear to favor yield-bearing products, while Bitcoin and Ether ETFs faced billions in redemptions.

Titre: UAE’s new financial law pulls DeFi and Web3 into regulatory scope
Résumé: Federal Decree Law No. 6 expands the UAE central bank’s authority over DeFi, ending the “just code” defense and imposing penalties of up to $272 million.

Titre: Pump.fun co-founder denies $436M cash out, claims it was ‘treasury management’
Résumé: The Pump.fun co-founder disputed claims of a massive off-ramp and said Pump.fun’s USDC shifts were routine treasury operations.

Titre: Exodus taps Bitcoin holdings to fund $175M move into onchain payments
Résumé: Exodus is using its Bitcoin reserves to back a $175 million acquisition of W3C Corp, bringing Monavate and Baanx under its roof as it expands into onchain payments.

Titre: Bitcoin at $87K: BTC buying opportunity or dead cat bounce?
Résumé: Bitcoin price tools returned to levels last seen several years ago as calls for a BTC price relief rally continued to grow louder.

Titre: Berachain disputes ‘framing’ of a $25M refund deal to Brevan Howard
Résumé: Berachain’s founder says a report that it gave one of its Series B investors a year-long refund right on its $25 million investment is both “inaccurate and incomplete.”

Titre: ‘OG whale’ who called the October crash has a $44.5M long on Ether
Résumé: The Hyperliquid whale that made $200 million in the October crash has just added another $10 million to its long position on Ether.

Titre: Crypto VC activity hits $4.6B in Q3, second-best quarter since FTX collapse
Résumé: Half of the capital raised in the third quarter was from seven venture deals, with Revolut leading the way with a $1 billion investment.

Titre: Bitcoin’s Sharpe ratio is nearly at zero, a rare risk-reward signal
Résumé: Bitcoin’s Sharpe ratio has fallen to nearly zero, matching levels from 2019, 2020, and 2022 market bottoms, as 8% of all BTC moved onchain in historic volatility.

Titre: BitMine, Strategy, SharpLink stocks outpace crypto market recovery
Résumé: Digital asset treasury stocks surged on Monday, led by BitMine, even outpacing the broader crypto market’s gains as institutional ownership increased.

Titre: SEC issues ‘rare’ no-action letter for Solana DePIN project token FUSE
Résumé: It comes several months after the SEC issued a similar no-action letter to DoubleZero, seen as a significant regulatory milestone for DePIN projects.

Titre: South Korea’s Upbit parent plans US IPO after Naver merger: Report
Résumé: US investors could soon get exposure to South Korea’s active crypto market, as crypto exchange Upbit’s parent company, Dunamu, reportedly eyes a Nasdaq listing.

Titre: Wall Street need not be squeamish about Bitcoin’s ups and downs: Pomp
Résumé: Bitcoiners aren’t new to 30% drawdowns, but it could be a first for many Wall Street investors, said crypto commentator Anthony Pompliano.

Titre: SOL rebounds alongside wider crypto market bounce: Is $160 possible?
Résumé: SOL price rallied to $140, but weak derivatives market metrics and stagnant network fees showed limited investor confidence. Is a retest of the $160 possible?

Titre: Here’s what happened in crypto today
Résumé: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

Titre: Mining economics tighten as record hashrate meets falling Bitcoin price: Report
Résumé: Mining margins weakened as hash prices declined and rig payback periods stretched, even as listed miners rallied on analyst upgrades and new HPC agreements.

Titre: Japanese watchdog to require exchanges to hold liability reserves: Report
Résumé: An advisory body to Japan's FSA will release a report recommending that crypto companies hold reserves to compensate users for events such as hacks.

Titre: Revolut hits $75B valuation following share sale, global push
Résumé: Revolut completed a private share sale with participation from major investment companies. The transaction also allowed employees to sell shares.

Titre: XRP jumps 8% as Franklin Templeton, Grayscale ETFs begin trading
Résumé: The investment vehicle tied to XRP launched amid other offerings from Grayscale, Bitwise Asset Management and Canary Capital.

Titre: Bitcoin data calls $80K the bottom as analysts say BTC bulls are back
Résumé: One analyst said Bitcoin’s dip to $80,000 marked the bottom and that there was a 91% chance the current trend reversal would send BTC price back to $118,000.

Titre: Price predictions 11/24: SPX, DXY, BTC, ETH, XRP, BNB, SOL, DOGE, ADA, BCH
Résumé: Several analysts claimed that Bitcoin bottomed at $80,000 and that the market has been reset. Do BTC and altcoin charts agree or reveal a different set of facts?

Titre: Ondo turns to Figure’s stablecoin with $25M investment to back tokenized fund
Résumé: The investment broadens Ondo Finance’s onchain Treasury reserves and comes amid a renewed push into crypto-backed lending across fintechs, lenders and exchanges.

Titre: Stand With Crypto to vet 2026 candidates on digital asset positions
Résumé: After the crypto industry’s success in influencing the 2024 US elections, the advocacy group announced plans to continue its efforts in the 2026 midterms.

Titre: Bitcoin rallies as US dollar strengthens: Are crypto traders walking into trap?
Résumé: Bitcoin reclaimed $86,000 as the US dollar strengthened, but one analyst warned the rally may be structurally weak.

Titre: Zcash down 30% from November’s top: Will ZEC price crash further?
Résumé: Analysts warn of “pump-and-dump” risks associated with ZEC’s sudden surge in hype, even as major crypto figures maintain a long-term bullish outlook.

Titre: Bitcoin price’s $80K low was bottom, Arthur Hayes says
Résumé: Bitcoin found its latest floor when it dropped to almost $80,000 last week, according to the BTC price prediction by ex-BitMEX CEO Arthur Hayes.

Titre: Quantum computers won’t break Bitcoin’s code, they’ll break its politics
Résumé: Bitcoin analyst James Check argued Bitcoin’s quantum risk is chiefly a consensus dilemma — not a tech one — because the network is unlikely to freeze legacy coins.
